correct_answer: The Industrial Revolution led to standardized and affordable housing for the middle class.
retrieved_context:
name: middle class
type: Social Class
description: The middle class is a social and economic group that typically falls between the working class and the upper class. It often includes professionals, managers, and small business owners. name: Urbanization and Mass Production
type: Historical Event
description: The rise of urbanization and mass production in the 19th and 20th centuries led to significant changes in housing, making it more standardized and affordable. name: American Dream
type: Concept
description: The American Dream is the set of ideals (such as equality, democracy, and liberty) that are held by many Americans. It often includes the belief in opportunities for prosperity and success, and an upward social mobility achieved through hard work. relation: middle class --[Achieved]-> American Dream--description:The middle class achieved the American Dream, particularly during the post-World War II period, with the rise of suburban homes as a symbol of this achievement.-- relation: American Dream --[Influenced By]-> Industrial Revolution--description:The Industrial Revolution brought about changes in home building and organization, which influenced the American Dream.-- relation: American Dream --[Influenced By]-> Post-World War II Period--description:The post-World War II period saw the rise of suburban homes as a key element of the American Dream.-- relation: American Dream --[Associated With]-> Levittown--description:Levittown is a notable example of how the American Dream was realized through affordable and standardized housing.-- relation: middle class --[Benefited From]-> Urbanization and Mass Production--description:The middle class benefited from the urbanization and mass production, which made housing more standardized and affordable.-- relation: middle class --[Lived In]-> Suburban Homes--description:The middle class lived in suburban homes that featured modern amenities, making life more comfortable and convenient.-- relation: American Dream --[Symbolized By]-> Suburban Home--description:The suburban home is often seen as a symbol of achieving the American Dream.-- relation: American Dream --[Influenced By]-> Urbanization--description:Urbanization contributed to the evolution of the American Dream by making housing more standardized and affordable.-- name: Suburban Homes

description: Suburban homes are typically located in areas outside of city centers and often feature modern amenities such as central heating, indoor plumbing, and electrical appliances. name: affordable housing

type: Social Group
description: The middle class is a social group that typically has moderate income and education levels. relation: Industrial Revolution --[Brought About]-> Standardized Housing--description:The Industrial Revolution led to the standardization of housing, making it more accessible to the middle class.-- name: New Building Materials

type: Sustainable Practice
description: Rainwater harvesting involves collecting and storing rainwater for various uses, such as irrigation, flushing toilets, and washing clothes. type: Design Concept
description: Passive solar design involves the use of building materials and techniques to capture, store, and distribute solar energy without the need for mechanical or electrical devices. relation: passive solar design --[Is Used With]-> green building techniques--description:Passive solar design is a key technique in green building practices to promote sustainability.-- name: renewable energy sources
type: Energy Source
description: Renewable energy sources are derived from natural processes that are replenished at a faster rate than they are consumed. type: Building Feature
description: Green roofs, also known as living roofs, are rooftops covered with vegetation and a growing medium, planted over a waterproofing membrane.
